conclusion: Properties of light reflection and speed of light in vacuum are needed to solve the problem.
Semi-circular glass brick with center O and radius R is placed on a horizontal desktop.
Incident angle is 60 degrees, light is totally reflected and parallel after exiting, speed of light in vacuum is c.
When light is totally reflected, angle of incidence equals angle of reflection.
Speed of light in vacuum is constant and equal to c.
Light travels along the circular surface of the glass brick due to total reflection.
Distance between OP can be calculated using the formula for the speed of light in vacuum: c = c/sin(theta).
Substitute theta = 60 degrees into the formula: c = c/sin(60 degrees).
Final answer: Distance between OP is 2c*sqrt(3)/3.
